bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Roland Alston family was an African American family residing in Durham, North Carolina. William Roland Alston, known as "Roland," was born to Ena and Alice Alston in Chatham County, North Carolina, in 1908. He married Stella Atwater in 1930; the couple had two children, Joeseph Lewis and William Roland Jr. Alston became the head gardener for Mary Duke Biddle at Pinecrest and later for the Semans family at Les Terraces, both properties located in Durham.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Roland Alston family papers comprise nine folders containing transcripts, some edited and some final, of eight oral history interviews Judy Hogan completed with Roland Alston. The original audio tapes or cassettes for the interviews are not included with the collection. Topics include his work for Mary Duke Biddle and the Semans family; growing up on a farm in Chatham County; Durham and regional businesses, especially those for gardeners; his family life; and his views on relationships between people, including employers and employees, men and women, and parent and child. Also includes 5 black-and-white and 5 color (one hand colored) uncaptioned photographs, including individual and group portraits, presumably of members of the Roland Alston family. The photographs range in size from 4 x 5 inches to 8 x 10 inches.
